name: Caesar Salad
description: All hail Caesar…salad! Crisp romaine, crunchy croutons, and funky parmesan come together with savoury, tangy, garlicky dressing that’s known worldwide. It’s easy to make at home and healthier than store-bought with less fat, less sodium, and more deliciousness. This isn’t a purist’s version of a Caesar salad, but it’s perfect for a weeknight meal.
preparation: Whisk first 7 ingredients in a large serving bowl. Season with Black Pepper.
Add Romaine lettuce and toss to coat.
tips: Lighten Up! Skip the oil and mayo and use instead 1⁄4 cup low-fat yogurt. You'll save 80 calories and 9 g of fat per serving!

products.name: Caesar Dressing Mix
summary: This dressing is a little bit of magic: It’s rich, creamy, full of flavour, and it has zero sodium! Take it far beyond Caesar salad and use it as a sauce for pizza, a dip for veggies, chicken fingers, and zucchini fries, or mix it in your white pasta sauce. Simply mix the blend with mayo or Greek yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, and milk, and it’s ready for anything!
